properties.name: Buddha Vihar Cox Town
properties.description:
Open: Sundays 11:00-13:00

A small Tibetan temple. There is a caretaker on the grounds who speaks English, Tamil, Hindi, and Kannada. The caretaker does not have the key to the temple and the laypeople and monks who open the temple on Sundays are not always on time.

Cushions and chairs are available inside.

properties.name: Dhamma Hall
properties.description:
Dhamma Hall for Vipassana students of S.N. Goenka. Group sitting times are 05:00-06:00 and 18:00-19:00 every day.

This location is directly related to Vipassana meditation as taught by S.N. Goenka.

properties.name: International Buddhist Seminary
properties.description:
Open: 06:00-12:00 and 16:00-20:00

The seminary has a large temple with ample space for sitting meditation. There are cushions available but no chairs. Enter from 9th Cross Road.

properties.name: Maha Bodhi Society
properties.description:
Open: 09:00-19:00

The Maha Bodhi Society has a large temple in the centre of the grounds. Remove your shoes to the right of the entrance and sign in if the guard requests. There are toilets to the right-hand side of the grounds; you can wear your shoes to walk to the toilets.

Inside the temple there are benches and cushions for meditation.

properties.name: Maha Bodhi Society
properties.description:
Open: Mo-Su 09:00-18:00

There is a large temple just inside the gate. There are usually police stationed outside or inside and you may need to explain that you are there for meditation. Sometimes monks will be inside the office. You can ask them for a mat to meditate on.

Thin bamboo mats and chairs are available.

properties.name: Mintogang Temple
properties.description:
Open: Mo-Su 05:30-06:30

This Bhutia temple is open for meditation from 05:30 to 06:30 every morning. The monk who opens the temple will perform a puja. Politely request permission to meditate in the temple. This will be easiest if you speak Bhutia or Hindi.

The entrance to the temple is around the northwest side, away from the road. If the monk has not opened it, it will be closed with a metal gate. Leave your shoes outside.
